result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs, blood draw fees and DNA surcharge within the term of Extended Supervision. Defendant to pay costs of supervision.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA Assessment and follow through with any recommendations resulting therefrom.
Defendant shall not possess any firearms.
Defendant shall submit a DNA sample if not already recorded/submitted; Court does assess the DNA surcharge.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants. The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(1:12) Defendant Brian J. Erickson in custody via video with attorney Greg E Vollan (will appoint).  Gilbert G Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. State requests $50,000 cash bond and recites record and bond conditions; Prelim requested within time limits. Prelim 6/19/14 at 3pm in Br. 3; Court sets bond at $50,000.00 CASH BOND with conditions:   Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety  and shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.  Restrictions on travel: Not leave State of WI without prior permission.  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
